name: places/ChIJVXHSNvz3wokRRAC93YXuVzs
formattedAddress: 36 W 106th St, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 36 W 106th St, New York, NY 10025-3805, USA

editorialSummary.text: Streamlined berths in a trendy capsule hostel featuring a coffee shop, lockers & Wi-Fi.

originalText.text:
First thing to note when booking a pod in this hostel is that you will sweat! The pods are ridiculously hot and the air conditioning is about as much use as a chocolate fire guard. The bed itself is relatively comfortable and the space is plentiful.

The service upon arrival was good, greeted with a smile and all the info I needed to check in, but it went downhill from them, purely based on the temperatures of the room and the pods. The vents are exceptionally noisy for what little cool air they push out.

If I was you and I was me again, I’d book somewhere else!

text.text:
First thing to note when booking a pod in this hostel is that you will sweat! The pods are ridiculously hot and the air conditioning is about as much use as a chocolate fire guard. The bed itself is relatively comfortable and the space is plentiful.

The service upon arrival was good, greeted with a smile and all the info I needed to check in, but it went downhill from them, purely based on the temperatures of the room and the pods. The vents are exceptionally noisy for what little cool air they push out.

If I was you and I was me again, I’d book somewhere else!

originalText.text:
1. the room and the en-suite bathroom were clean but the bathrooms outside of the room were disgusting.
2. Speaking of the staff, they were very friendly.They were always available to answer any questions,which made my stay much more comfortable.
3. They offered a free breakfast, it saved me time and money but breakfast options were basic.
4. Another positive aspect of this hostel was the presence of lockers, provided a safe space to store my valuables.
5. The location was excellent. It was situated next to central park and within walking distance of supermarkets.Additionally, the area felt safe.
6. one area where the hostel could improve is the common areas.I felt that with a few small upgrades could be transformed into more inviting spaces.
7. I did find the lack of an elevator on all five floors to be quite challenging.
8. it would have been great if the hostel organised some activities for guests to socialize and meet one another.
Despite these minor areas for improvement, I would still highly recommend this hostel.

originalText.text: This is the best hostel I've ever stayed at! The price was cheap around $60 per night. The beds have sliding doors that close and give you privacy as if you had your own private room. Each bed has controls for air circulation, light, mirror color etc. There are also only USB slots in the bed no wall outlet. They provide you with a blanket and towels. Each room has a locker to put your belongings in. Keep in mind that it does get pretty hot at night especially with the bed sliding door closed so make sure to put on the AC before getting into bed. The sliding doors can be quite loud if you want to adjust the AC in middle of the night. Overall I had a great experience!

originalText.text: My pod was broken, the clerk didn’t know the first thing about customer service. Not even going to waste my energy breaking down how bad the service was. They ended up giving me a new room that wasn’t heated. Awful business, place is very rough around th edges, things are broken, Pods, bathroom stalls, etc. and I was only there for a few hours. I’m sure I would have encountered more unfortunate surprises had I stayed a couple days.

originalText.text: I stayed at Kama for two weeks over Christmas and new years. It was so convenient, three blocks from a subway station and easy to get everywhere I needed to go. Massive shoutout to Haivyn who made my trip so special - sharing the insider NYC secrets and being so kind and friendly. All of the staff were helpful, kind and overall a really good experience.
